TEXT.English: [TAB]Hollow men are the ghosts of those who served Mulcarn in the Age of Ice. They are most common around Letum Frigus and typically appear and thin, pale, indefinite creatures that are nearly invisible in a snowstorm. They rarely attack formidable opponents, preferring to find those freezing in the wastes and steal the last bits of warmth from their bodies.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Hollow men are the ghosts of those who served Mulcarn in the Age of Ice. They are most common around Letum Frigus and typically appear and thin, pale, indefinite creatures that are nearly invisible in a snowstorm. They rarely attack formidable opponents, preferring to find those freezing in the wastes and steal the last bits of warmth from their bodies.

They rarely attack formidable opponents, preferring to find those freezing in the wastes and steal the last bits of warmth from their bodies.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dybbuk are malicious spirits that can control the soul of someone who recently died. They have little power over the just, though those burdened with sin are easy prey for them. The Dybbuk can force the soul to possess a living or dead host.[NEWLINE][TAB]When a Dybbuk leaves a corrupted soul in the body of a dead host it becomes a ghoul.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The Dybbuk are malicious spirits that can control the soul of someone who recently died. They have little power over the just, though those burdened with sin are easy prey for them. The Dybbuk can force the soul to possess a living or dead host.[NEWLINE][TAB]When a Dybbuk leaves a corrupted soul in the body of a dead host it becomes a ghoul.

They have little power over the just, though those burdened with sin are easy prey for them. The Dybbuk can force the soul to possess a living or dead host.[NEWLINE][TAB]When a Dybbuk leaves a corrupted soul in the body of a dead host it becomes a ghoul.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dybbuk are malicious spirits that can control the soul of someone who recently died. They have little power over the just, though those burdened with sin are easy prey for them. The Dybbuk can force the soul to possess a living or dead host.[NEWLINE][TAB]When a Dybbuk leaves a corrupted soul in the body of a dead host and the Dybbuk remains to strengthen and control the soul then the creature is known as a Wight. Wights are more powerful than ghouls and their touch steals the life and strength of their victim. Although Dybbuk prefer to not draw too much attention to themselves when threatened they can usually raise a group of ghouls lead by a wight to defend themselves.

Wights are more powerful than ghouls and their touch steals the life and strength of their victim. Although Dybbuk prefer to not draw too much attention to themselves when threatened they can usually raise a group of ghouls lead by a wight to defend themselves.
